subject: Error, application of complex numbers with function JUnit TestCase.assertEquals
msgSnippet: I do just my first experiences with JUnit. Complicated figures of applications should be no problem in JUnit, I imagine in such a way. Then is here certainly
messageBody:
I do just my first experiences with JUnit. Complicated figures of
applications should be no problem in JUnit, I imagine in such a way.
Then is here certainly where the mistake in my thinking?

The function:
TestCase.assertEquals(-java.lang.Math.sqrt((this.rk0.holeKnotenImag()*(-1))),
this.rk2.holeKnotenImag(), -java.lang.Math.sqrt(java.lang.Math.PI));

The failure:
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: expected:<-1.7724538509055159>
but was:<-1.7724538509055159>
at
KomplexerKnotenTest.testGetKnoten(KomplexerKnotenTest.java:48)
at
sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at
sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)

The test program:
/*
* KomplexerKnotenTest.java
*
* Created on 31. MÃ¤rz 2006, 14:03
*
* To change this template, choose Tools | Options and locate the
template under
* the Source Creation and Management node. Right-click the template
and choose
* Open. You can then make changes to the template in the Source Editor.
*/
import junit.framework.TestCase;
import java.lang.Math;
/**
*
* @author Fm_5599
*/
public class KomplexerKnotenTest extends TestCase
{
private static KomplexerKnoten rk0, rk1, rk2;
/** Creates a new instance of KomplexerKnotenTest */
public KomplexerKnotenTest(String name)
{
super(name);
}
public void testCreation()
{
this.rk0 = new KomplexerKnoten();
this.rk1 = new KomplexerKnoten(java.lang.Math.PI,
-java.lang.Math.PI);
this.rk2 = new
KomplexerKnoten(java.lang.Math.sqrt(java.lang.Math.PI),
-java.lang.Math.sqrt(java.lang.Math.PI));
}
public void testGetKnoten()
{
TestCase.assertTrue(rk0.holeKnotenReal()==java.lang.Math.PI);
TestCase.assertTrue(rk0.holeKnotenImag()==-java.lang.Math.PI);

TestCase.assertEquals(this.rk0.holeKnotenReal(),
this.rk1.holeKnotenReal(), java.lang.Math.PI);
TestCase.assertEquals(this.rk0.holeKnotenImag(),
this.rk1.holeKnotenImag(), java.lang.Math.PI);

TestCase.assertTrue(rk2.holeKnotenReal()==
java.lang.Math.sqrt(this.rk0.holeKnotenReal()));
TestCase.assertTrue(rk2.holeKnotenImag()==-
java.lang.Math.sqrt((this.rk0.holeKnotenImag()*(-1))));


TestCase.assertEquals(java.lang.Math.sqrt(this.rk0.holeKnotenReal()),
this.rk2.holeKnotenReal(),
java.lang.Math.sqrt(java.lang.Math.PI));

TestCase.assertEquals(-java.lang.Math.sqrt((this.rk0.holeKnotenImag()*(-1))),

this.rk2.holeKnotenImag(),
-java.lang.Math.sqrt(java.lang.Math.PI));
}
public void testToString()
{
TestCase.assertEquals("Real: "+java.lang.Math.PI+"; Imag: -"
+java.lang.Math.PI,this.rk0.toString());
TestCase.assertEquals("Real: "+java.lang.Math.PI+"; Imag: -"
+java.lang.Math.PI,this.rk1.toString());
TestCase.assertEquals("Real:
"+java.lang.Math.sqrt(java.lang.Math.PI)+"; Imag: -"
+java.lang.Math.sqrt(java.lang.Math.PI),
this.rk2.toString());
}
}

best regards
fm_5599
